conclusion: The wooden blocks are arranged in a line on a green surface.
When A drives into the group of blocks, it will cause a collision.
The power of the collision will depend on the speed and angle at which A approaches the blocks.
If A is moving at a high speed and hits the blocks head-on, it will likely cause the blocks to scatter in different directions.
The deflection effects will also play a role in determining the final position of the blocks.
If A hits the blocks at an angle, it may cause some blocks to be deflected in one direction while others are deflected in another.
The final position of the blocks will depend on the combination of these factors.
